skill.name: vercel-deploy
skill.description:
Use when deploying Next.js applications to Vercel.
Triggers for: vercel.json configuration, build optimization, environment variable setup,
custom domain configuration, API proxy setup, or deployment troubleshooting.
NOT for: backend-only deployments, non-Vercel hosting, or local development setup.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with a validation script. The main SKILL.md contains deployment guidance with no executable code. The verify.py script only reads and validates the SKILL.md format using regex parsing. No network calls, no file writes, no command execution, no environment variable access beyond command-line arguments.

content.value_statement: Deploy Next.js applications to Vercel with optimized build settings, environment variables, and custom domain configuration. Expert guidance for production-ready deployments.
actual_capabilities: Configure vercel.json with build commands and regions
Set up environment variables for production and preview
Configure custom domains and DNS settings
Create API proxy rewrites and redirects
Set up custom error pages and redirects
limitations: Does not execute deployments (requires Vercel CLI)
Does not manage non-Vercel hosting platforms
Does not configure local development environments

prompt_templates.title: Basic Vercel Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me deploy my Next.js app to Vercel. I need to create a vercel.json configuration file with the correct build settings.

prompt_templates.title: Environment Variables
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up environment variables for my Next.js app on Vercel. Which variables need the NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix and which should stay server-only?

prompt_templates.title: Custom Domain
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a custom domain for my Vercel deployment. How do I set up DNS records and HTTPS?

prompt_templates.title: API Proxy
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up API proxy rewrites in vercel.json to route /api requests to my backend API at api.example.com.

output_examples.input: Help me deploy my Next.js app to Vercel for the first time
output: Create vercel.json with build command and output directory
Configure environment variables in Vercel Dashboard
Install Vercel CLI and run 'vercel login'
Run 'vercel link' to connect your project

best_practices: Always use NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix only for variables that need client access
Test builds locally with 'npm run build' before deploying
Use vercel.json regions to deploy closest to your users
Configure custom error pages (404, 500) before going live
anti_patterns: Avoid using wildcard domains without proper DNS configuration
Do not expose sensitive API keys with NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix
Never hardcode API URLs; use environment variables instead

faq.question: Does this skill deploy my application?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides configuration guidance. You must run 'vercel --prod' or use Vercel Git integration to actually deploy.

faq.question: What Next.js versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Next.js 13+ with App Router. Works with Pages Router but some features are optimized for App Router.

faq.question: How do I deploy from CI/CD?
faq.answer: Use 'vercel --token=$VERCEL_TOKEN --yes' in your pipeline. Requires VERCEL_TOKEN from Vercel Dashboard.

faq.question: Is my code safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill. It only reads your vercel.json and configuration files.

faq.question: Why is my build failing on Vercel?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing dependencies, incorrect build command, environment variables not set, or platform-specific code.

faq.question: How is this different from Vercel CLI?
faq.answer: This skill provides configuration guidance and troubleshooting. Vercel CLI is the actual tool that performs deployments.
